Package projects.suffixtree

Class SuffixTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.suffixtree.SuffixTree
  • public class SuffixTree
extends java.lang.Object

    SuffixTree is a Suffix Tree that allows you to check whether a string is a substring of another string efficiently

    Author:
    Jason Filippou & Ping Chiang

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected static java.lang.RuntimeException UNIMPL_METHOD  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SuffixTree​(java.lang.String inputString)
      The constructor of the SuffixTree

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> inOrderTraversal()
      Perform an in order traversal of the Suffix tree, but only return the strings represented by the leaf nodes and not the inner nodes This is equivalent to returning a list of suffixes by lexicographical order
      boolean isSubstring​(java.lang.String checkString)
      Check whether a string is a substring of the internal string
      java.lang.String longestRepeatedSubstring()
      Find the longest repeated substring in the internal string
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> matches​(java.lang.String checkString)
      Find matches of a string in the internal string
      int nodeCount()
      Count the number of nodes in the Suffix tree
      int numTimesOccurs​(java.lang.String checkString)
      Count the number of a times a string is repeated in the internal string
      java.lang.String shortestRepeatedSubstring​(int minLength)
      Find the shortest repeated substring in the internal string that has at least a certain length.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SuffixTree

        public SuffixTree​(java.lang.String inputString)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The constructor of the SuffixTree
        Parameters:
        inputString - The string that we will build the Suffix tree for
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the argument is null, has length smaller than 1, or includes $ sign

    • Method Detail

      • matches

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> matches​(java.lang.String checkString)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Find matches of a string in the internal string

        Parameters:
        checkString - the string that we will try to match to the internal string
        Returns:
        a list of integers containing the indices where the checkString and the internal string matches
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if checkString is an empty string or null

      • isSubstring

        public boolean isSubstring​(java.lang.String checkString)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Check whether a string is a substring of the internal string

        Parameters:
        checkString - the string that we will check against the internal string
        Returns:
        true if and only if checkString is a substring of the internal string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if checkString is an empty string or null

      • numTimesOccurs

        public int numTimesOccurs​(java.lang.String checkString)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Count the number of a times a string is repeated in the internal string

        Parameters:
        checkString - the string that we will check against the internal string
        Returns:
        the number of times checkString is repeated in the internal string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if checkString is an empty string or null

      • longestRepeatedSubstring

        public java.lang.String longestRepeatedSubstring()

        Find the longest repeated substring in the internal string

        Returns:
        the longest repeated string in the internal string When there is a tie, break the tie based on lexicographical order

      • shortestRepeatedSubstring

        public java.lang.String shortestRepeatedSubstring​(int minLength)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Find the shortest repeated substring in the internal string that has at least a certain length.

        Parameters:
        minLength - the smallest length that the repeated string has to exceed
        Returns:
        the shortest repeated string that has at least length minLength. When there is a tie, break the tie based on lexicographical order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the minLength is smaller than or equal to 0

      • nodeCount

        public int nodeCount()

        Count the number of nodes in the Suffix tree

        Returns:
        the number of nodes in the Suffix tree

      • inOrderTraversal

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> inOrderTraversal()

        Perform an in order traversal of the Suffix tree, but only return the strings represented by the leaf nodes and not the inner nodes This is equivalent to returning a list of suffixes by lexicographical order

        Returns:
        a list of suffixes ordered by lexicographical order
